com.camerontec.catalys.server.breakout.policyengine

Class AbstractBreakoutPolicyEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.breakout.policyengine.AbstractBreakoutPolicyEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBreakOutPolicyEngine
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleBreakOutPolicyEngine

    public abstract class AbstractBreakoutPolicyEngine
extends Object
implements IBreakOutPolicyEngine
    An abstract frame work that makes it easy to implement IBreakOutPolicyEngine. It splits the work out into a number of simple MessageHandler classes which are charged with making the decisions for each message type.

    Each message handler class is responsible for handling one kind of message. It implements a set of methods that have the same names as the methods on IBreakOutPolicyEngine but have two extra parameters: indices and context.

    indices is an per-session general index that maps an ID (e.g., ClOrdID, IOIID, ...) to an instance of BrokenOutMessageData. indices is used by the message handlers to track a broken out message, and is maintained by AbstractPolicyEngineMessageHandler.onMessageAdded(), AbstractPolicyEngineMessageHandler.onMessageRemoved() and AbstractPolicyEngineMessageHandler.onMessageRecovered(). E.g., an order message handler would maintain an index of broken out orders indexed by ClOrdID.

    context is a place to store data that is shared by all the handlers.

    Subclasses should implement getMessageHandlers() to return a map of AbstractPolicyEngineMessageHandler instances and may override makeHandlerContext() so that it returns a subclass of HandlerContext.

    Author:
    Hugh Emberson
    See Also:
    AbstractPolicyEngineMessageHandler, PerSessionIndices, HandlerContext

        mess - the message
        Returns:
        a RelatedMessagePolicyAction in which responseMessage and messageToRemove may be set. stopProcessing will be true iff the given message is related to a message that is already in the box. breakOut will be true if the given message is to be broken out.
